reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our first time in this resort and we were not dissapointed. stunning beach but a word of warning, there are fish that can give a nasty, even fatal sting and the warning signs are few and far between (we only saw one on the beach bar). footwear when swimming in the sea is essential. the setting is gorgeous and the staff are friendly but not obtrusive. if you want a quiet chill, this is the place but you have to get to the sunbeds early as the russians tend to reserve the best ones early. food was plentiful and varied but the wine was not for the more discerning palate. we will definately be going again. the only downside was a very strong wind for most of the week which made the evening outside a bit chilly, take something warm to wear at night.
reviews.title: nice beach, shame about the wind

reviews.text: It was our 2nd visit to the Hilton Coral and it was fab. The staff remembered us from last year and were so friendly and helpful. They cannot do enough for you and are always so happy and involve you in what they are doing. Given the hours that they work and what they are paid it is truly amazing and it does make it feel so much like home from home.
reviews.title: 2nd visit and still superb!

likes.disliked: — Learn some Arabic or take a phrasebook!

reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room again (after all you don't spend much time indoors) and whilst it could perhaps do with a touch of updating (kind of early 90's style), they are perfectly clean and comfortable which is the main thing. Drinks always provided in the fridge and towels are normally made into 'crocodiles' or 'snakes' which is amusing.
reviews.title: Returning visitor

reviews.text: Even though the Hilton Coral is the only hotel there, there is so much to do - crazy golf, snorkelling, pedalos, kayaks, croquet lawn, tennis, squash, evening entertainment or just laze on the beach and there is a PADI dive shop although it seems to have increased in price since last year. There is a a little bit of coral a bit further out, but regardless, the fish you can see are amazing - the pier is also good for this. We were lucky enough to see a large sea turtle this trip.
reviews.title: Great place to relax

likes.liked: — clean and comfortable with nice views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are definately looking to go back, in terms of value for money and enjoyment of stay you simply cannot beat it and there is always food that is more than edible to have. If you have specific dietary requirements, it is no problem for them to cook you a 'special meal'. We always travel with Longwood who have brilliant reps and their tours on offer are fab, with immensely knowledagble tour guides. The tours are amazing, we did Massada & Dead Sea last year and Petra this year.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for the Christmas week and had one of the best holidays ever. We read previous Trip Advisor reviews and used these to help our decision to stay at the Hilton Coral Resort in Nuweiba. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: The staff make it

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the rooms and lots of hot water

reviews.text: The staff make this hotel what it is. Very helpful with a sense of humour and friendly. The food was varied and we especially enjoyed some of the Egyptian specialities. We made friends with Egyptians, Russians, Germans as well as English and we particularly appreciated the Father Christmas arriving on a camel. My wife enjoyed the beachside boogie with Father Xmas. We were not surprised to meet people returning on their 4th or 5th stay and one lady we met had been there 17 years in succession!
reviews.title: The Coral at xmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only small criticism of the holiday is not of the hotel but the hotel is the last in the transfer list as it is the furthest away so it can sometimes take up to 2 hours to get from the airport or Israeli border with all the various stops at other hotels.
reviews.title: A total relaxation place.

likes.liked: — The lovely beach and Casa Pesto

reviews.text: Despite this we enjoyed a good day trip to Jerusalem and the Dead Sea.
reviews.title: Oldie but Goodie

likes.liked: — site of possible red sea crossing, nice grounds
likes.disliked: — food and room just fair, dive master rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for a great holiday. We would certainly recommend it to others.
reviews.title: What can I say, it was lovely

likes.liked: — Comfortable, clean and spacious with great views
likes.disliked: — A bit outdated but still very pleasant

reviews.title: Cold but a great resort!
reviews.text: We arrived on Christmas Day night. We had asked for a double room - after being shown to a twin-bedded one it was changed within 15 mins to what we wanted.

reviews.title: New Year @ The Hilton. Nuweiba!
reviews.text: The staff here were very helpful & friendly, the food was excellent in all the restaurants & the New Years Eve Gala dinner was fantastic. Our room was of a very high standard & cleaned well every day. We enjoyed tipping the staff - remember that their basic salary is so low you can double it by giving them £1 a day! They certainly deserve it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed that it was the coldest for 8 years when we were there - we didn't brave the water. But we had some sunny days & loved the adjoining beach & excellent bar. The resort & gardens are beautifully maintained. I am amazed at the bad comments on here about the wine! I only drink wine, not spirits, & found that the white they serve on the all-inclusive is a Pinot variety from Alexandria on the Med. I was very happy with that & the red was good too.
reviews.title: room upgrade
We will be going back soon!!
reviews.text: I thought the disco was great for a holiday resort - some local entertainment first then a good mix of music with plenty of older 70's/80's, not only pounding new stuff. I thought the local singers were pretty good too - OK they have a bit of an accent but they do songs you know & the club has a good atmosphere.

It was well worth getting outside the resort & visiting the nearby village (they do all want you to buy something but it's fairly easy to say no - we bought a few things to support the locals). The nearby port is an experience & very safe. Local Bedouin taxis we found were good & excellent value as we booked through our rep. Half the price of the hotel ones.
reviews.title: xmas break at hilton coral

likes.liked: — clean and spacious with a connecting room to our teenagers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with my partner at the Hilton in October 2004. We had an amazing time there, and I firmly believe that you make your own enjoyment.
reviews.title: Fabulous time, great people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes some of the food was a bit repetetive, but I wouldn"t use the word suspect as some reviewers have. It makes me mad when people whinge about little things. Whilst some people are whingeing remember the staff who are trying to make it a great place to be!
reviews.title: Fantastic.

likes.disliked: — Just perfect (but if upgrading again, a gym would be nice!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, the staff fantastic, they made the holiday. We met some fantastic people, who we still keep in touch with and who have since returned to the Coral.
reviews.title: Very relaxing and so beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for some of the negative comments about the coral reef, ok it's not huge but it serves a purpose, and gives entertainment to people. It was fantastic watching people snorkel for the first time, they were so excited.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever

reviews.text: All in all I don't know what people want out of a holiday, we, my partner and I have stayed in hotels all over the world, and I have to say given a choice we would return to the Hilton again without hesitation.I feel that some people will complain no matter what, but you know what?Unless the place is infested, or my life was in danger, and as long as there's somewhere to lie down in the sun, a place to swim, I really couldn't care less.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back - again!!!

likes.liked: — Tasteful, clean and a real oasis in the desert
